summary: This is an email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York responding to discovery requests related to the investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It addresses requests for information about BOP interviews, housing decisions, incident reports, and provides a BOP investigative report regarding the July 22/23 incident with minimal redactions.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate who was housed with Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU and is the subject of discovery requests regarding BOP interviews and the July 22/23 incident.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein, the deceased inmate whose death is under investigation. The email discusses materials related to him, including his medical records and allegations he made against Tartaglione.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell in the SHU (Special Housing Unit) at the MCC, as referenced in the discovery request about the housing decision.

events.title: Epstein Incident in Custody
events.description: The incident involving Jeffrey Epstein in custody on July 22/23, 2019, which is the subject of a BOP investigative report and discovery requests. The exact nature is not specified but is central to the investigation.

locations: SHU (Special Housing Unit, presumably at MCC)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office confirms no audio/video recordings exist of BOP interviews with inmate Tartaglione.
No documentation exists regarding the decision to house Tartaglione and Epstein together in the same SHU cell.
No After Action Report was prepared by BOP for the July 22/23 incident involving Epstein.
A BOP investigative report related to the July 22/23 incident is being produced with minimal redactions (duty roster and parts of Epstein's medical records).
The email indicates BOP may have conducted an investigation into Tartaglione based on allegations made by Epstein.
